<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>The 25th James Bond movie finally has a title, <em>No Time To Die</em>. To celebrate, we’ll give you four cocktails. You have to decide whether they’re traditionally shaken or stirred. </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Manhattan</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Cosmopolitan</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Daiquiri</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Martini</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Answer at the bottom.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/20/trump-considering-various-tax-cuts-juice-economy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Trump’s Looking for Answers
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Trump’s Looking for Answers" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY2MzM3MTQ4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After a tumultuous couple of weeks, the Trump administration <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/20/us/politics/trump-economy-recession-data.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is considering</a> adding some magic powder to juice the U.S. economy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The economy’s been gangbusters before and after Donald Trump’s inauguration in January 2017. Unemployment is hanging at a 50-year low and consumers <a href="https://thehill.com/policy/finance/457594-consumer-spending-jumps-in-july-beating-expectations-amid-recession-fears?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">continue to spend</a> as freely as ever. However, equal parts trade war, economies faltering in Europe, and yield curve inversion have conspired to create a cocktail of recession anxieties. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Earlier in the week, Trump took out frustrations on his favorite punching bag: the Fed. But yesterday he confirmed he’s thinking about “various tax reductions” of his own while <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2019/08/20/donald-trump-weighing-payroll-tax-cuts-steps-economy/2061234001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">arguing</a> the economy is fine without resorting to those moves. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Option No.1: Payroll tax cut </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trump said he’s considering a temporary cut to the payroll tax. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What that is: </strong></span><span>U.S. worker income up to $132,900 annually </span><span><a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/kellyphillipserb/2019/08/20/as-rumors-swirl-heres-what-a-payroll-tax-cut-might-look-like/#6c626dca35f0?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is docked</a></span><span> 6.2% to fund Social Security and 1.45% to fund Medicare. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Pros: </strong></span><span>A cut could potentially add billions to Americans’ take-home income.  </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Cons: </strong></span><span>It would probably add to the deficit and drain Social Security. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Option No. 2: Capital gains tax cut </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trump also floated a capital gains tax reduction, indexing the tax to inflation. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What that is</strong></span><span>: A tax levied on profitable investment sales. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Pro</strong></span><span>: A cut would benefit wealthy investors. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Con: </strong></span><span>Without first getting congressional approval, it would </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/white-house-officials-try-to-bolster-economy-even-as-they-praise-it-11566321939?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">likely be challenged</a></span><span> in court the moment Trump signed it. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What went unmentioned...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...were concerns about the U.S.-China trade conflict, which is causing major economic worries. Last month, the Fed <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/05/business/economy/fed-powell-monetary-policy.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released a report</a> concluding the trade war may be limiting business spending. Hugging it out with President Xi would probably provide the boost Trump's looking for.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>A faltering economy could seriously impair Trump’s campaign for reelection. The state of the economy can make or break an incumbent; just ask Jimmy Carter in 1980.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EUROPE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/20/italys-prime-minister-announces-resignation-blames-interior-minister?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Italian Prime Minister: “I Quit and That Guy’s a Jerk”
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Italian Prime Minister: “I Quit and That Guy’s a Jerk”" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY2MzM4OTA3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/legalcode" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC-BY-4.0</a>: © European Union 2019 – Source: EP</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Italy’s prime minister Giuseppe Conte <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/20/italian-prime-minister-conte-resigns.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced his resignation</a> yesterday after blaming his own interior minister of sabotaging the country’s institutions. It’s how Ned Stark would have done it. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That interior minister is Matteo Salvini, the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/20/world/europe/italy-pm-giuseppe-conte-resign.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surging star</a> and leader of the far-right League party. Last summer, his party linked up with the populist Five Star Movement to form a government, but around two weeks ago Salvini said, “hey fellas...this isn’t going to work out” and called for snap elections. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s not working out in Italy:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Economic growth is what economists like to call “</span><span><a href="https://tradingeconomics.com/italy/gdp-growth?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nonexistent</a></span><span>.”   </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>With a Mt. Everest of public debt that’s more than 130% of GDP (second in Europe only to Greece), Italy’s debt burden </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/4015dae4-a4b0-11e9-974c-ad1c6ab5efd1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">breaks EU rules</a></span><span>. The country has to figure out its budget by this fall.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">There’s the rub: </strong>Salvini’s clashed with Brussels over the EU’s fiscal requirements. “I don’t want Italy to be a slave to anyone, and I don’t want Italy to be given a long chain like a little dog,” <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-italy-politics/italian-pm-to-resign-denounces-salvini-for-sinking-government-idUSKCN1VA0TE?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">he said</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>expect either snap elections or the formation of a new coalition that freezes Salvini out.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/20/surf-web-without-zuck-peeking?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Surf the Web Without Zuck Peeking
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Surf the Web Without Zuck Peeking" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/14nR89kC0mcYU0/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Surf the Web Without Zuck Peeking" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/14nR89kC0mcYU0/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Facebook users in Ireland, Spain, and South Korea got first dibs on <a href="https://newsroom.fb.com/news/2019/08/off-facebook-activity/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a new privacy tool</a> that disconnects their activity on other websites from Facebook’s data collection. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">FB tracks me when I’m not on the site? </strong>Welcome back to our collective privacy awakening of 2k18. Facebook has embedded business tools on other sites—like those facilitated logins—that scrape your internet activity even when you're not on its platforms. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The new tool, called “Off-Facebook Activity,” shows users which apps/sites send their browsing data to FB. Users can then dissociate their personally identifying information from Facebook's activity-tracking data, and reconnect later if they're missing the companionship of a toothpaste ad. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Zuck </span><span><a href="https://www.facebook.com/zuck/posts/10104899855107881?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a></span><span> the tool in May 2018, but it was delayed as Facebook figured out how to redesign its information processing systems. After all, it’s hard to build privacy tools when your business is grounded on knowing everything users do.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Reality check: </strong>Facebook’s acting like it’s doing everyone a big privacy favor...but remember it’s reacting to various regulatory inquiries and a user base that’s decided privacy is en vogue.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/20/american-factory-explores-dynamics-globalization-midwest?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
American Documentary Drops Today
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjQxL2FmX3RoZWF0cmljYWwtcmVsZWFzZV8xd19qcGcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Netflix</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">18 years ago today, Nickelback released “How You Remind Me.” We suggest you mark the event with a documentary that will remind you about how globalization has affected the Midwest.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>American Factory,</em> created by filmmakers Steve Bognar and Julia Reichert, <a href="https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/story/2019-08-15/american-factory-documentary-filmmakers-obamas?utm_source=CNN+Media%3A+Reliable+Sources&utm_campaign=cfe4d9f231-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2018_09_11_04_47_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_e95cdc16a9-cfe4d9f231-91638605&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is available</a> on Netflix today. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Gone Hollywood: </strong></span><span>The doc is the first title released from Higher Ground, Barack and Michelle Obama’s production company. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Some backstory...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The beginning: </strong>In 2008, GM shuttered a plant that assembled trucks outside of Dayton, OH, leaving around 2,700 employees without work.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The middle: </strong>In 2014, a lifeline. <span>A Chinese billionaire invested in the plant and hired over 1,000 Americans to work alongside Chinese employees at Fuyao Glass America, an automotive glass maker. </span>Bognar and Reichert decided to chronicle the shift in a feature-length film, spotlighting the cultural differences between Chinese and American employees on issues like working conditions and time off.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The end:</strong> Reviewers <a href="https://variety.com/2019/film/reviews/american-factory-review-2-1203198182/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">say</a> the resulting film is an even-handed exploration of global commerce at a time when it's as relevant as ever.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You can watch it tonight. Socializing is for nerds.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNET
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/20/oldest-operating-internet-webcam-will-shut?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We’ll Miss You, FogCam
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="We’ll Miss You, FogCam" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY2MzMzNDk4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>FogCam</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This month, the oldest operating internet webcam will shut down, the site’s administrators <a href="https://www.sfgate.com/technology/article/SF-worlds-oldest-webcam-live-stream-Twitch-14341998.php/#item-85307-tbla-43?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> Saturday. <a href="http://www.fogcam.org/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">FogCam</a> started as a student project at San Francisco State University (go Gators) and, barring a few location changes and maintenance updates, has faithfully broadcast campus images since 1994. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">FogCam was inspired by the first internet webcam, a <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-20439301?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">coffee pot livestream</a> created by scientists at the University of Cambridge. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">By today’s standards, FogCam’s pretty simplistic. But in 1994, when the internet was pay-per-minute, it was cutting edge. FogCam's basically a lock for the Smithsonian Guggenheim Museum of Internet History.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Early webcams gave internet users their first taste of streaming. In the decades since, they’ve sped up, streamlined, and democratized video communications.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">FogCam co-founder Jeff Schwartz said Adam Curry used it as a model for his website (something called “MTV”). And another early webcam of a fish tank—created by Netscape’s founding engineer Lou Montulli—<a href="https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/ev8wyj/the-oldest-livestream-webcam-fishcam-netscape?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">served as a testbed</a> for internet improvements that laid the foundation for e-commerce, GIFs, and uploaded photos.</p>

max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter a tumultuous couple of weeks, the Trump administration \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/20/us/politics/trump-economy-recession-data.html?action=click\u0026module=Top%20Stories\u0026pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis considering\u003c/a\u003e adding some magic powder to juice the U.S. economy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe economy’s been gangbusters before and after Donald Trump’s inauguration in January 2017. Unemployment is hanging at a 50-year low and consumers \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/policy/finance/457594-consumer-spending-jumps-in-july-beating-expectations-amid-recession-fears?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtinue to spend\u003c/a\u003e as freely as ever. However, equal parts trade war, economies faltering in Europe, and yield curve inversion have conspired to create a cocktail of recession anxieties. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEarlier in the week, Trump took out frustrations on his favorite punching bag: the Fed. But yesterday he confirmed he’s thinking about “various tax reductions” of his own while \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2019/08/20/donald-trump-weighing-payroll-tax-cuts-steps-economy/2061234001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003earguing\u003c/a\u003e the economy is fine without resorting to those moves. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOption No.1: Payroll tax cut \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTrump said he’s considering a temporary cut to the payroll tax. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat that is: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eU.S. worker income up to $132,900 annually \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/kellyphillipserb/2019/08/20/as-rumors-swirl-heres-what-a-payroll-tax-cut-might-look-like/#6c626dca35f0?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis docked\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e 6.2% to fund Social Security and 1.45% to fund Medicare. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePros: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA cut could potentially add billions to Americans’ take-home income.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCons: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt would probably add to the deficit and drain Social Security. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOption No. 2: Capital gains tax cut \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTrump also floated a capital gains tax reduction, indexing the tax to inflation. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat that is\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: A tax levied on profitable investment sales. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePro\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: A cut would benefit wealthy investors. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCon: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWithout first getting congressional approval, it would \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/white-house-officials-try-to-bolster-economy-even-as-they-praise-it-11566321939?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elikely be challenged\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in court the moment Trump signed it. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat went unmentioned...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e...were concerns about the U.S.-China trade conflict, which is causing major economic worries. Last month, the Fed \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/05/business/economy/fed-powell-monetary-policy.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased a report\u003c/a\u003e concluding the trade war may be limiting business spending. Hugging it out with President Xi would probably provide the boost Trump's looking for.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eA faltering economy could seriously impair Trump’s campaign for reelection. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eItaly’s prime minister Giuseppe Conte \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/20/italian-prime-minister-conte-resigns.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced his resignation\u003c/a\u003e yesterday after blaming his own interior minister of sabotaging the country’s institutions. It’s how Ned Stark would have done it. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat interior minister is Matteo Salvini, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/20/world/europe/italy-pm-giuseppe-conte-resign.html?action=click\u0026module=Top%20Stories\u0026pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurging star\u003c/a\u003e and leader of the far-right League party. Last summer, his party linked up with the populist Five Star Movement to form a government, but around two weeks ago Salvini said, “hey fellas...this isn’t going to work out” and called for snap elections. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s not working out in Italy:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eEconomic growth is what economists like to call “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://tradingeconomics.com/italy/gdp-growth?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enonexistent\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.”   \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWith a Mt. Everest of public debt that’s more than 130% of GDP (second in Europe only to Greece), Italy’s debt burden \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/4015dae4-a4b0-11e9-974c-ad1c6ab5efd1?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebreaks EU rules\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. The country has to figure out its budget by this fall.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThere’s the rub: \u003c/strong\u003eSalvini’s clashed with Brussels over the EU’s fiscal requirements. “I don’t want Italy to be a slave to anyone, and I don’t want Italy to be given a long chain like a little dog,” \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-italy-politics/italian-pm-to-resign-denounces-salvini-for-sinking-government-idUSKCN1VA0TE?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehe said\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Facebook users in Ireland, Spain, and South Korea got first dibs on \u003ca href=\"https://newsroom.fb.com/news/2019/08/off-facebook-activity/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea new privacy tool\u003c/a\u003e that disconnects their activity on other websites from Facebook’s data collection. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFB tracks me when I’m not on the site? \u003c/strong\u003eWelcome back to our collective privacy awakening of 2k18. Facebook has embedded business tools on other sites—like those facilitated logins—that scrape your internet activity even when you're not on its platforms. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe new tool, called “Off-Facebook Activity,” shows users which apps/sites send their browsing data to FB. Users can then dissociate their personally identifying information from Facebook's activity-tracking data, and reconnect later if they're missing the companionship of a toothpaste ad. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eZuck \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/zuck/posts/10104899855107881?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the tool in May 2018, but it was delayed as Facebook figured out how to redesign its information processing systems. After all, it’s hard to build privacy tools when your business is grounded on knowing everything users do.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReality check: \u003c/strong\u003eFacebook’s acting like it’s doing everyone a big privacy favor...but remember it’s reacting to various regulatory inquiries and a user base that’s decided privacy is en vogue.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe beginning: \u003c/strong\u003eIn 2008, GM shuttered a plant that assembled trucks outside of Dayton, OH, leaving around 2,700 employees without work.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe middle: \u003c/strong\u003eIn 2014, a lifeline. \u003cspan\u003eA Chinese billionaire invested in the plant and hired over 1,000 Americans to work alongside Chinese employees at Fuyao Glass America, an automotive glass maker. \u003c/span\u003eBognar and Reichert decided to chronicle the shift in a feature-length film, spotlighting the cultural differences between Chinese and American employees on issues like working conditions and time off.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe end:\u003c/strong\u003e Reviewers \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2019/film/reviews/american-factory-review-2-1203198182/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esay\u003c/a\u003e the resulting film is an even-handed exploration of global commerce at a time when it's as relevant as ever.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou can watch it tonight. class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eFogCam\u003c/a\u003e started as a student project at San Francisco State University (go style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFogCam was inspired by the first internet webcam, a \u003ca style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBy today’s standards, FogCam’s pretty simplistic. But in 1994, when the internet was pay-per-minute, it was cutting edge. FogCam's basically a lock for the Smithsonian Guggenheim Museum of Internet History.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eEarly webcams gave internet users their first taste of streaming. href=\"https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/ev8wyj/the-oldest-livestream-webcam-fishcam-netscape?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px
